pr_title: Switch common test config utils to use a per-file cache

timeline.message: Switch common test config utils to use a per-file cache
Switch common test config utils to use a per-file cache
Switch common test config utils to use a per-file cache

timeline.bodyText: what if the outline has changed? we need to clear out the cache in that case.
timeline.author: jacob314

replies.bodyText:
The outline given will be null and the cache will be cleared. CF: the comments above and the documentation for outlineService.getIfUpdated: flutter-intellij/src/io/flutter/editor/ActiveEditorsOutlineService.java Lines 187 to 194 in f69eec4 /** * Gets the {@link FlutterOutline} for {@param file} if and only if the outline is up to date with the file. * *

* Returns null if the file is out of date. */ @Nullable public FlutterOutline getIfUpdated(@NotNull PsiFile file) {
replies.author: DaveShuckerow

replies.bodyText:
that is not a safe assumption.
The only assumption safe to depend on is the outline will be null if it is out of date.
For example, imagine if another service such as the the widget indent guides or HotUI is also requesting outlines using ActiveEditorsOutlineService, you could easily get a non-null outline even though it is different than the outline your cache is based on.
replies.author: jacob314

replies.bodyText:
This code checks if the outline is outdated and returns null if so.
If you have suggestions for how to improve the heuristic, they are welcome.
replies.author: DaveShuckerow

replies.bodyText: the getIfUpdated method is fine as written. What you need to do is not depend on getting a null outline for the case that there was an update. To do that you should store what the outline was in CommonTestConfigUtils so that you can tell if you have gotten a new outline so need to update your cache.
replies.author: jacob314

timeline.bodyText: caching DartCallExpressions will cause us to hang on to old IntelliJ ASTs and leave us vulnerable to if IntelliJ recomputes AST nodes. It is safer to use file offsets as keys.
timeline.author: jacob314

timeline.message: Use integer offsets instead of callexpressions

timeline.bodyText:
optimization: move this findElementAt call so you only call it when unit_test_group or unit_test_test is found. Currently we are doing this fairly expensive operation a lot more times than we need to.
I do like that you are still using
file.findElementAt to avoid location calculation bugs.
timeline.author: jacob314

timeline.message: Start a cache of previous outlines

timeline.bodyText:
nit: rather than two maps with the same key, define a class  with both the
FltuterOutline and the Map<Integer, TestType> as fields.
timeline.author: jacob314

timeline.bodyText: nit: remove the result local variable.
timeline.author: jacob314

timeline.bodyText:
nit: the cleaner pattern for this in java is
final entry = cache.get(path);
timeline.author: jacob314

timeline.bodyText: nit: cache the OutlineCache entry as a local variable so you don't have to read it out of a cache.
timeline.author: jacob314
